Reviews.Title: MUST HAVE data plan =/
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Phone is amazing. Alot better than I thought It would be. BUT I can't use it because I don't have internet in my service plan. I can't even use it for call/text without having to pay $70 a month for data...

Reviews.Title: Cell phone
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I really like this phone, it works great. It has a lot of features my old phone did'nt have and its not complicated to use.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from Tracfone!
Reviews.Author: tAsTytEmPAi
Reviews.Content: I was using Tracfone and their phones for 3 years because I never really used the phone...but this past semester of school, I have been getting calls/texts like crazy and was spending around $10 per week -- $40 per month. =/I decided to research a new (prepaid) phone plan to try out, and came across a company called PlatinumTel...They had this great deal where when you purchased $100 in minutes (which don't need to be refilled for 1 year), you got this phone for free!A lot of my classmates have the iphone and blackberries etc. I really wanted a nice phone like they had, and since it was so affordable I decided to try it out. IN FACT, I didn't believe it would be this nice, as I only purchased it because of the great deal since I am studying abroad in 5 months and will need to buy a new phone in that country -- This phone was so nice, I am bringing it with me, at least for an alarm, notepad, camera etc!This is the iphone for those of us who like pay-as-you-go and don't want to spend a fortune!It has a great camera, fast internet, mp3 player, television, radio, lots of games and downloadable apps. It is really pretty, and easy to use. Although I have sent a few texts and received calls, I haven't transferred my number over yet...but I LOVE this phone!I highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: B. Moran
Reviews.Content: Great phone. Works well. Only complaint is that the keypad is small and hard to hit if you have large fingers.

Reviews.Title: thinking smart:
Reviews.Author: Kaytlyn
Reviews.Content: So my brother wanted a phone, because his broke awhile ago.But he didn't have enough money to buy a new 300-500 phone from sprint.So I suggested he just buy a refurbished no contract phone.OF COURSE, the phone they sent has stuff wrong with it. Main problem, it doesn't charge. Charger/phone didn't work.BUT we have insurence. So we bought this phone, took it to sprint as if we bought it from them, they replace it for free. :)

Reviews.Title: samsung sph m800 instinct
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: to be clear it is not the sellers fault that the phone is not a good phone.  okay for a kid but I would never use it myself.  it's android like but you can not even get on google play store you have to go to sprint's game site and buy games or apps.  it is hard to get it to respond when you touch it.  I would not recommend it if you want a real android phone.

Reviews.Title: Useless phone
Reviews.Author: Evelyn M Ortega
Reviews.Content: This phone was completely useless. GIANT PAPER WEIGHT. Waste of $40.00.  The phone did not work with the sprint network as promised.  Sprint said phone was useless and not part of their network.  So much for that.

Reviews.Title: Instinct...........again
Reviews.Author: Angruiz
Reviews.Content: This is the second Instinct phone I own, it is an excellent phone that gives you internet, e-mail, text, and more. It can be a great replacement phone since you may end up paying less for this than what your deductible is for a lost or stolen phone.

Reviews.Title: Kept Messing up
Reviews.Author: J.Alston
Reviews.Content: I recieved the phone on time that was a plus, it also came with two batteries but no charger so I had to go purchase one. The phone worked fine during sunlight but once I got in dark places with little heat the phone would freeze up and i would have to rub the phone to get it to work. Well this was a bother to me so I eventually switched back to my old phone b/c it got to the point where I could mash the buttons and the touch screen stopped working.

Reviews.Title: crap phone
Reviews.Author: Ricky Vosler
Reviews.Content: the phone sucks it always needs a recharged battery and the processing is slow as molasses i would not recommend this phone to anyone that would like to buy it because it is not worth the money the touch screen is horrible and always freeze's on u i would have rather spent the money on a more expensive phone with better features and better overall handling

Reviews.Title: cell phone
Reviews.Author: Angela D. Dixon "Dixon"
Reviews.Content: great phone works great. easy to get activated as a replacement phone or new account with sprint. the phone has a lot of features to it i love it. thanks will recommend with the highs stars. also this customer do not send you what he say. it's not a new phone buy the way its used.

Reviews.Title: Worlds Dumbest Smart Phone!!!
Reviews.Author: JKL
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Key pad is way to small and the auto correct never even come close to what you mistyped. Try sending a picture. Sometimes it takes half an hour if it ever sends it at all. Hot garbage!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smart Phone
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I used this phone for 2 months before my employer issued a company phone (an Android Incredible).  And I miss the Samsung Instinct.  I like this phone a lot more than the Incredible.  This phone is lighter and easier for me to use.  The GPS was great, and I used it a lot.  The charger plug is nicer than the Incredible too. Great Phone!

Reviews.Title: caveat empetor
Reviews.Author: manufan
Reviews.Content: Great phone...  all the features as advertised... but don't buy if you're not willing to pony up for Sprint's Data Package (despite phone assurances to the contrary made in advance of purchasing)

Reviews.Title: Phone with someone else's number
Reviews.Author: Penelope_of_Ithaca
Reviews.Content: When I bought this phone, I thought that I could register it with my old cell phone number.  When I received it, though, it still had another person's phone number on it, and worse, that number did not share an area code with my state.  Also disappointing was the fact that I could not register it with a Platinumtel account.  The seller, however, was kind enough to let me keep the phone, as well as giving me my money back.

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: This phone was pretty good once i got it today but what i didn't like was that I'M NOT A SPRINT USER at all but luckily i will sign up This is a cellphone worth getting.
